title: How to Store a Piano

steps.headline: Lower or increase the temperature of the environment the piano sits in gradually.
steps.description: If the piano is going from a heated environment into a cool or cold one, or vice versa, give it a chance to acclimatize. Any sudden cooling or sudden heating will harm the piano.

steps.headline: Choose an appropriate storage space.
steps.description: The piano must be kept dry and generally cool. Avoid placing it anywhere that is damp, moist, or humid. If you do, the piano will begin to deteriorate rapidly.

steps.headline: Clean the piano.
steps.description: Wipe it down the remove the dust and give it a good polish.

steps.headline: Cover the piano.
steps.description: Another enemy of the piano is dust getting into its inner workings. When stored, the piano should be fully covered.

steps.headline: Protect the piano.
steps.description: Prior to adding a cover, wrap the piano in blankets to protect it from knocks and bangs in storage and when being shifted. The blankets can be tied into place with string or yarn.

steps.headline: Check the piano regularly if in long-term storage.
steps.description: If you see signs of damage, you can get them treated upon checking rather than leaving it to completely fall into disrepair.

text: Lower or increase the temperature of the environment the piano sits in gradually. If the piano is going from a heated environment into a cool or cold one, or vice versa, give it a chance to acclimatize. Any sudden cooling or sudden heating will harm the piano. Choose an appropriate storage space. The piano must be kept dry and generally cool. Avoid placing it anywhere that is damp, moist, or humid. If you do, the piano will begin to deteriorate rapidly. Clean the piano. Wipe it down the remove the dust and give it a good polish. Cover the piano. Another enemy of the piano is dust getting into its inner workings. When stored, the piano should be fully covered. Protect the piano. Prior to adding a cover, wrap the piano in blankets to protect it from knocks and bangs in storage and when being shifted. The blankets can be tied into place with string or yarn. Check the piano regularly if in long-term storage. If you see signs of damage, you can get them treated upon checking rather than leaving it to completely fall into disrepair.
